channel.title: Help with Tut
channel.description:
Hello, I need someone who can do this tut for me, I've tried more then 3 times and i got 100 errors every time i compiler, Here's what i were trying to add: [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/snippets/387812-clipped-projectiles-pi-version.html]Clipped Projectiles [PI version][/url]
If you can help me adding this here's my skype: Naseem1311

item.title: Help with Tut
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

I’m confused on why there is “REMOVED” even in the region methods that you added.

And for the autocasting maybe try adding a public boolean autocasting or an integer for it in the client class.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Tut
item.dc:creator: @Naseem Naseem
item.description:
@Naseem wrote:

^ I’ve did what you said and i got this time 6 errors, Lets hope that you can help me now:

The errors: http://oi40.tinypic.com/25z2ixd.jpg

The codes where it shows that i got errors:

1- The followplayer method taken from the tut:

/*if(c.playerIndex > 0) {
			Client o = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[c.playerIndex];
			if(c.getPA().pathBlocked(c, o)) {
				if((c.usingBow || c.usingMagic || /*usingOtherRangeWeapons || */c.autocasting/* || handCannon*/))
					PathFinder.getPathFinder().findRoute(c, o.absX, o.absY, true, 8, 8);
				if(!c.usingBow && !c.usingMagic && /*!usingOtherRangeWeapons && */!c.autocasting)
					PathFinder.getPathFinder().findRoute(c, o.absX, o.absY, true, 1, 1);
				return;

2- The error in region class taken from the clipping “public static boolean pathBlocked(Client attacker, Client victim) {” method:

for (int i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
			if (!Region./*getSingleton().*/getClipping(path[i][0], path[i][1], path[i][2], path[i][3], path[i][4])REMOVED) {
				return true;	
			}
		}

3- The error in region class taken from this “public static boolean pathBlocked(NPC attacker, Client victim) {” method:

for (int i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
			if (!Region./*getSingleton().*/getClipping(path[i][0], path[i][1], path[i][2], path[i][3], path[i][4])REMOVED) { // clipped projectiles by aleksandr
				return true;	
			}
		}

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Tut
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

[quote=“Naseem, post:8, topic:535038”][quote author=Bl3nd link=topic=653839.msg4380379#msg4380379 date=1383326797]
Does your source have a Position.java or maybe even Region.java class? If it does, add those first 2 in that, and see what you get.
[/quote]

I’d have the region class but i don’t have the position class, If i must add it, Do you have a tut for adding the position class?[/quote]

The region class should work fine. Add those methods somewhere in there and see if you get errors or something doesn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Tut
item.dc:creator: @Naseem Naseem
item.description:
@Naseem wrote:

Bl3nd:

Usually a 100 error is caused by a missing bracket in your code. See if you forgot a missing bracket or not.

DAn0194:

Your missing a bracket.

I will check if i’m missing a bracket.

…

According to this tut, Clipped projectiles for Pi
I’m not sure where i should paste this code "Player vs player check"
here:

// Clipping
	public static boolean pathBlocked(Client attacker, Client victim) {
		
		double offsetX = Math.abs(attacker.absX - victim.absX);
		double offsetY = Math.abs(attacker.absY - victim.absY);
		
		int distance = TileControl.calculateDistance(attacker, victim);
		
		if (distance == 0) {
			return true;
		}
		
		offsetX = offsetX > 0 ? offsetX / distance : 0;
		offsetY = offsetY > 0 ? offsetY / distance : 0;

		int[][] path = new int[distance][5];
		
		int curX = attacker.absX;
		int curY = attacker.absY;
		int next = 0;
		int nextMoveX = 0;
		int nextMoveY = 0;
		
		double currentTileXCount = 0.0;
		double currentTileYCount = 0.0;

		while(distance > 0) {
			distance--;
			nextMoveX = 0;
			nextMoveY = 0;
			if (curX > victim.absX) {
				currentTileXCount += offsetX;
				if (currentTileXCount >= 1.0) {
					nextMoveX--;
					curX--;	
					currentTileXCount -= offsetX;
				}		
			} else if (curX < victim.absX) {
				currentTileXCount += offsetX;
				if (currentTileXCount >= 1.0) {
					nextMoveX++;
					curX++;
					currentTileXCount -= offsetX;
				}
			}
			if (curY > victim.absY) {
				currentTileYCount += offsetY;
				if (currentTileYCount >= 1.0) {
					nextMoveY--;
					curY--;	
					currentTileYCount -= offsetY;
				}	
			} else if (curY < victim.absY) {
				currentTileYCount += offsetY;
				if (currentTileYCount >= 1.0) {
					nextMoveY++;
					curY++;
					currentTileYCount -= offsetY;
				}
			}
			path[next][0] = curX;
			path[next][1] = curY;
			path[next][2] = attacker.heightLevel;//getHeightLevel();
			path[next][3] = nextMoveX;
			path[next][4] = nextMoveY;
			next++;	
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
			if (!Region./*getSingleton().*/getClipping(path[i][0], path[i][1], path[i][2], path[i][3], path[i][4])REMOVED) {
				return true;	
			}
		}
		return false;
	}

Same thing for the this one:

	private static Region singleton = null;

	public static Region getSingleton() {
		if (singleton == null) {
			singleton = new Region();
		}
		return singleton;
	}

I’ve added both of them in PlayerAssistant class, and that’s why I’ve got that 100 errors.

last code

public static boolean pathBlocked(NPC attacker, Client victim) {
		
		double offsetX = Math.abs(attacker.absX - victim.absX);
		double offsetY = Math.abs(attacker.absY - victim.absY);
		
		int distance = TileControl.calculateDistance(attacker, victim);
		
		if (distance == 0) {
			return true;
		}
		
		offsetX = offsetX > 0 ? offsetX / distance : 0;
		offsetY = offsetY > 0 ? offsetY / distance : 0;

		int[][] path = new int[distance][5];
		
		int curX = attacker.absX;
		int curY = attacker.absY;
		int next = 0;
		int nextMoveX = 0;
		int nextMoveY = 0;
		
		double currentTileXCount = 0.0;
		double currentTileYCount = 0.0;

		while(distance > 0) {
			distance--;
			nextMoveX = 0;
			nextMoveY = 0;
			if (curX > victim.absX) {
				currentTileXCount += offsetX;
				if (currentTileXCount >= 1.0) {
					nextMoveX--;
					curX--;	
					currentTileXCount -= offsetX;
				}		
			} else if (curX < victim.absX) {
				currentTileXCount += offsetX;
				if (currentTileXCount >= 1.0) {
					nextMoveX++;
					curX++;
					currentTileXCount -= offsetX;
				}
			}
			if (curY > victim.absY) {
				currentTileYCount += offsetY;
				if (currentTileYCount >= 1.0) {
					nextMoveY--;
					curY--;	
					currentTileYCount -= offsetY;
				}	
			} else if (curY < victim.absY) {
				currentTileYCount += offsetY;
				if (currentTileYCount >= 1.0) {
					nextMoveY++;
					curY++;
					currentTileYCount -= offsetY;
				}
			}
			path[next][0] = curX;
			path[next][1] = curY;
			path[next][2] = attacker.heightLevel;//getHeightLevel();
			path[next][3] = nextMoveX;
			path[next][4] = nextMoveY;
			next++;	
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
			if (!Region./*getSingleton().*/getClipping(path[i][0], path[i][1], path[i][2], path[i][3], path[i][4])REMOVED) { // clipped projectiles by aleksandr
				return true;	
			}
		}
		return false;
	}

Well i’m just asking where exactly i have to add this three codes in case i added them in wrong class?

Read full topic
